intro: Kohleria mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf kohleria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture, while its flowers come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Kohleria mollis is well-suited for greenhouse cultivation due to its preference for warm, humid environments.
